newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan insurers' yen bond purchases surge in March.
newsitem.headline: Japan insurers' yen bond purchases surge in March.

text.p: Japanese insurers rushed to buy yen bonds in March in order to fulfill their investment targets for the fiscal year that ended on March 31, an official at the Japan Securities Dealers' Association (JSDA) said on Monday.

"A large amount of bond purchases by insurers in March was largely due to their portfolio-adjustment activity before the fiscal year-end. Insurers who had been behind the schedule had to rush to meet their investment targets," the official said.
Life and non-life insurers' net yen bond purchases totalled 1.7143 trillion yen in March, the highest since August 1995 when they bought a record 2.3085 trillion yen worth of bonds, the JSDA said.
Insurers' net yen bond purchases in February were worth 238.8 billion yen.
The figures include Japanese government bonds, notes and Treasury bills, financing bills, corporate bonds and bank debentures.
